title: Heart of a Marionette: understanding the nature of child neglect and abuse
abstract: This creative project is an epistolary novel in the form of a diary of a young girl named Caroline Kusnadi, who is usually referred to as Carol. She is the daughter of a family of four, whose parents are divorced. She writes her diary entries while trying to survive her mother’s and sister’s worsening mistreatments toward Carol even though they know Carol’s condition. In this creative work, I use child neglect and abuse my topic, and I propose to understand the nature of child maltreatment as my theme. With this, I can show the experiences of child neglect and abuse itself from the eyes of the victims. This story was created based on how Indonesia society does not pay sufficient attention and appropriate measures in protecting children’s rights. This would be shown on how Carol’s father, mother, and sister for not giving necessary treatments for Carol, who should have to deserve more than she has.
contributors: Dwi Setiawan (Advisor and Examination Committee); Stefanny Irawan, S.S., M.A. (Examination Committee 2); Prof. Budi Darma (Advisor 3)
subjects: CHILD ABUSE IN LITERATURE; CHILD ABUSE
